trans-unit.source: Contains <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> values used to join and drop multicast groups.
Use a MulticastOption to store the <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> of a multicast group you want to join or drop.
Use the <xref:System.Net.Sockets.Socket.SetSocketOption%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method with the following parameters to join a multicast group.

|Parameter|Value| |---------------|-----------| |socketOptionLevel|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionLevel?displayProperty=fullName>| |socketOptionName|<xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName>| |object|MulticastOption| Use <xref:System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName> to drop a multicast group.
Initializes a new version of the <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption"></xref> class for the specified IP multicast group.
For machines with multiple network cards, do not use this constructor.
Use the constructor that takes a group and a local IP address.
The <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> of the multicast group.
group is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption"></xref> class with the specified IP multicast group address and interface index.
The <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> of the multicast group.
The index of the interface that is used to send and receive multicast packets.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption"></xref> class with the specified IP multicast group address and local IP address associated with a network interface.
For machines with multiple network cards, you must use this constructor to create <xref:System.Net.Sockets.MulticastOption> instances.
The group <xref:System.Net.IPAddress>.
The local <xref:System.Net.IPAddress>.
group is .
-or- mcint is .
Gets or sets the IP address of a multicast group.
Valid IP addresses for multicast packets are in the range 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255.
An <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> that contains the Internet address of a multicast group.
Gets or sets the index of the interface that is used to send and receive multicast packets.
An integer that represents the index of a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface> array element.
Gets or sets the local address associated with a multicast group.
The LocalAddress property contains the IP address of the interface associated with the multicast group membership.
If LocalAddress is set to <xref:System.Net.IPAddress>, the default interface is used.
An <xref:System.Net.IPAddress> that contains the local address associated with a multicast group.
